title: A watch sold for $605 brings 10% profit. What is its cost? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is profit this means cost price is less than the selling price. So by using formula Seeling price × 100÷(100+profit%) if profit Then by putting value in the formula 605×100÷(100+10)=605×100÷110=550$

Selling price of the watch = $ 605 let the Cost price be 'C' C + 10%(C) = 605 C + 0.1C = 605 1.1C = 605 C = 605/1.1 = 550 therefore, the CP is $ 550. To check : CP = 550 10% of CP = 10%(550) = 55 SP = 550 + 55 = 605. therefore the Cost of the Watch is $ 550.
